titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation for the discovery and apprehension of a French Jesuite, stiling himself Monsieur Saint Germain, and his accomplices in the late violence offered to Monsieur Luzancy, alias Chastelet.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II)
Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the assigns of John Bill and Christopher Barker, printers to the Kings most excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: At end of text: Given at our court at Whitehall the tenth day of November, in the seven and twentieth year of our reign.
Steele notation: Arms 87 Lu- all 2) take all.
Two copies filmed consecutively at UMI Tracts Supplement reel C18; these filmed copies consist of one contiguous sheet.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
